Class CustomDialog

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
Direct Known Subclasses:
YetAnotherCustomDialog
public abstract class CustomDialog
extends javax.swing.JDialog

CustomDialog is a custom JDialog implementation, providing a simple solution for complex user input. It must be extended for proper implementation of the user actions, and for eventual additional fields. Its behavior is modal by default and the expected usage is :

  • construct it providing the type, which will define the available button actions and its positioning, and the properties file, which can be learned from the customdialog.properties file present in this package;
  • set its contained panel with setView(JComponent panel);
  • set it visible with setVisibleToUser();
  • when the window is closed and the execution comes back, the last action performed by the user can be inspected through getUserAction() method as well as its state.

A generic code snippet would be something like this: ... try { InputStream is = CustomDialog.class.getResourceAsStream("/org/aprestos/code/bok/gui/customdialog/customdialog.properties"); Properties props = new Properties(); props.load(is); CustomDialog dialog = new CustomDialog(null,props,CustomDialogType._OK_) {
